classes.title: WOLO401
classes.subtitle: Elementary Wolof I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course enables students who have no previous experience in Wolof to develop speaking, listening and understanding, writing, and reading skills in Wolof. Students will also be exposed to Wolof culture.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: WOLO402
classes.subtitle: Elementary Wolof II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course enables students who have no previous experience in Wolof to develop speaking, listening and understanding, writing, and reading skills in Wolof. Students will also be exposed to Wolof culture.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: WOLO402
classes.subtitle: Elementary Wolof II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course is for students who have already acquired the basics of Wolof to reinforce their ability to learn speaking, listening and understanding, writing, and reading Wolof. Evidence of basic knowledge of Wolof is required.Requisites: Prerequisite, WOLO�401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: WOLO403
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Wolof III.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course is for students who have already acquired the basics of Wolof to reinforce their ability to learn speaking, listening and understanding, writing, and reading Wolof. Evidence of basic knowledge of Wolof is required.Requisites: Prerequisite, WOLO�401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: WOLO403
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Wolof III.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course is intended for learners who have already acquired Wolof proficiency in WOLO�401 and 402. It increases communicative proficiency and language learning ability as well as proficiency in cultures of the Wolof people.Requisites: Prerequisite, WOLO�402.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: WOLO404
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Wolof IV.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course reinforces students' communicative and cultural skills via gradual exposure to increasingly challenging tasks. Reading poetry and prose, and introduction to creative writing will be stressed.Requisites: Prerequisite, WOLO�403.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: WOLO405
classes.subtitle: Advanced Wolof V.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course reinforces students' communicative and cultural skills via gradual exposure to increasingly challenging tasks. Reading poetry and prose, and introduction to creative writing will be stressed.Requisites: Prerequisite, WOLO�403.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: WOLO405
classes.subtitle: Advanced Wolof V.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course is intended for learners who have acquired Wolof proficiency in WOLO�403 and 404. It provides students with the communication and linguistic skills needed to communicate fluently at the near-native level.Requisites: Prerequisite, WOLO�404.Grading status: Letter grade.
